Question: Which one of the following vehicles can you drive on a car licence?
You are driving in a 100km/h speed area and you see an Accident sign. What speed must you slow down to?
Before making a lane change to your left, you must signal for at least 3 seconds. What else must you do?

Answers.Answer: Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights) to warn other road users
Use your vehicle hazard lights to warn other road users
Check your blind spot before moving left
Ensure that there are no oncoming vehicles

Question: A police officer can impound your car on the spot if you are caught driving while disqualified.
You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving as the cyclist has to stop
Stop and give way to the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Which person can legally stop and do a roadside check of your vehicle?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do before turning left into a driveway?

Answers.Answer: Check the driveway is clear and enter
Signal only if there is a vehicle behind you and enter
Signal for 3 seconds or more and if the driveway is clear, enter
Signal only if another vehicle is coming towards you and enter

Question: The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.
When coming up to a Stop sign, where should you stop?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: Who can require you to undergo a breath screening test?
If you have a learner licence you can carry passengers if your supervisor is in the back seat.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: When should you use the fog lights on your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are in a hurry during the day
When you are coming up to an airport at night
When there is no fog but you want other drivers to see you
When you cannot see because of foggy conditions

Question: What colour is the line painted on a sealed road at a Give Way sign?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: If you are under 20, which statement is correct?

Answers.Answer: You are not permitted to drink any alcohol before driving
You may drink two standard glasses of alcohol
You may drink one standard glass of alcohol
There are no restrictions on limits of alcohol but you are not able to drive if intoxicated

Question: What does the legal definition of a road include?
Flush medians can be used when:
When following a vehicle on a dusty metal (gravel) road, you should:

Answers.Answer: keep close to the other vehicles
drive down the centre of the road
adjust your speed to suit the conditions
pass the vehicle in front of you

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
You are turning right at traffic signals showing a red arrow pointing to the right. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on but give way to all oncoming vehicles
Stop and wait for a green arrow
Drive on straight ahead only if it is safe
Drive on because all oncoming vehicles are stopped

Question: The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top right corner of the windscreen

Question: What should you do if the vehicle behind you starts to pass you?

Answers.Answer: Move over to the right so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Signal for them to stay behind you because you think they are going too fast
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe and do not speed up

Question: Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
A medical doctor, other crash party, a police officer
A police officer, a medical doctor or an approved person
An ambulance driver, an approved person or a medical doctor

Question: You have a restricted licence. A condition for driving at night without a supervisor is that you MUST NOT drive between:
You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: What must you do when turning right at a roundabout?

Answers.Answer: Not indicate at any time on the roundabout
Indicate left before entering the roundabout
Indicate right before entering the roundabout
Indicate right when leaving the roundabout
